projectId.description: Optional entity ID - positive integer without timestamp conversion

prompts.description: Array of suggested prompts ordered by relevance (most relevant first)

userInput.description: The user input describing what they want to accomplish

limit.description: Maximum number of prompts to suggest (default: 5, max: 10)

fileName.description: Generated filename for the exported prompt

content.description: The markdown content of the exported prompt
The markdown content for single-file export

files.description: Array of exported files for multi-file export

exportedAt.description: ISO 8601 datetime when export was generated

totalSize.description: Total size of exported content in bytes

projectId.description: Optional project ID to filter prompts by project

format.description: Export format: single file with all prompts or separate files per prompt

includeFrontmatter.description: Whether to include frontmatter with metadata

includeCreatedDate.description: Whether to include created date in frontmatter

includeUpdatedDate.description: Whether to include updated date in frontmatter

includeTags.description: Whether to include tags in frontmatter (if available)

sanitizeContent.description: Whether to sanitize content for safe markdown export

sortBy.description: How to sort the exported prompts

items.description: Entity ID - positive integer without timestamp conversion

promptIds.description: Array of prompt IDs to export

format.description: Export format: single file with all prompts or separate files per prompt

includeFrontmatter.description: Whether to include frontmatter with metadata

includeCreatedDate.description: Whether to include created date in frontmatter

includeUpdatedDate.description: Whether to include updated date in frontmatter

includeTags.description: Whether to include tags in frontmatter (if available)

sanitizeContent.description: Whether to sanitize content for safe markdown export

sortBy.description: How to sort the exported prompts

success.description: Whether this individual prompt import succeeded

promptName.description: The name of the prompt being imported

promptId.description: ID of the created/updated prompt (only present on success)

error.example: Prompt with this name already exists

success.description: Overall success status of the import operation

promptsProcessed.description: Total number of prompts found in the file

errors.description: Global errors that affected the entire file

warnings.description: Global warnings for the import operation

success.description: Overall success status (true if at least one prompt imported)

totalPrompts.description: Total number of prompts found across all files

failed.description: Number of prompts that failed to import

id.description: Entity ID - positive integer without timestamp conversion

projectId.description: Entity ID - positive integer without timestamp conversion

summaryLastUpdated.description: ID or Timestamp in unix timestamp (milliseconds)

created.description: ID or Timestamp in unix timestamp (milliseconds)

updated.description: ID or Timestamp in unix timestamp (milliseconds)

ollamaUrl.description: Custom Ollama server URL to use instead of the default.

lmstudioUrl.description: Custom LMStudio server URL to use instead of the default.

temperature.description: Controls the randomness of the output. Lower values (e.g., 0.2) make the output more focused, deterministic, and suitable for factual tasks. Higher values (e.g., 0.8) increase randomness and creativity, useful for brainstorming or creative writing. A value of 0 typically means greedy decoding (always picking the most likely token).

maxTokens.description: The maximum number of tokens (words or parts of words) the model is allowed to generate in the response. This limits the output length and can affect cost. Note: This limit usually applies only to the *generated* tokens, not the input prompt tokens.

topP.description: Controls diversity via nucleus sampling. It defines a probability threshold (e.g., 0.9). The model considers only the smallest set of most probable tokens whose cumulative probability exceeds this threshold for the next token selection. Lower values (e.g., 0.5) restrict choices more, leading to less random outputs. A value of 1 considers all tokens. It's often recommended to alter *either* `temperature` *or* `topP`, not both.

frequencyPenalty.description: Applies a penalty to tokens based on how frequently they have already appeared in the generated text *and* the prompt. Positive values (e.g., 0.5) decrease the likelihood of the model repeating the same words or phrases verbatim, making the output less repetitive. Negative values encourage repetition.

presencePenalty.description: Applies a penalty to tokens based on whether they have appeared *at all* in the generated text *and* the prompt so far (regardless of frequency). Positive values (e.g., 0.5) encourage the model to introduce new concepts and topics, reducing the likelihood of repeating *any* previously mentioned word. Negative values encourage staying on topic.

topK.description: Restricts the model's choices for the next token to the `k` most likely candidates. For example, if `topK` is 40, the model will only consider the top 40 most probable tokens at each step. A lower value restricts choices more. Setting `topK` to 1 is equivalent to greedy decoding (same as `temperature: 0`). Less commonly used than `topP`.

stop.description: Specifies one or more sequences of text where the AI should stop generating. Once the model generates a stop sequence, it will halt output immediately, even if `maxTokens` hasn't been reached. Useful for structured output or controlling conversational turns.

response_format.description: Specifies the desired format for the model's response. This is highly provider-specific. A common use case is enforcing JSON output, often requiring specific model versions.

provider.description: The provider to use for the AI request.

model.description: The model to use for the AI request.

AiSdkOptions.description: Optional parameters to override default model behavior (temperature, maxTokens, etc.).

prompt.description: The text prompt for the AI.
prompt.example: Suggest 5 suitable filenames for a typescript utility file containing helper functions for string manipulation.

systemMessage.description: Optional system message to guide the AI behavior and persona.
systemMessage.example: You are an expert programmer. Provide concise and relevant suggestions.

text.description: The generated text response from the AI.

output.description: The generated structured data, validated against the schema defined by the 'schemaKey'.

schemaKey.description: The key identifying the predefined structured task configuration.

userInput.description: The user's input or context for the structured generation task.
userInput.example: A react component for displaying user profiles

allOf.description: Optional: Override default model options (temperature, etc.) defined in the task configuration.
